[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@rushstack/heft](./heft.md) &gt; [IHeftParsedCommandLine](./heft.iheftparsedcommandline.md) &gt; [commandName](./heft.iheftparsedcommandline.commandname.md)

## IHeftParsedCommandLine.commandName property

Returns the subcommand passed on the Heft command line, before any aliases have been expanded. This can be useful when printing error messages that need to refer to the invoked command line.

**Signature:**

```typescript
readonly commandName: string;
```

## Remarks

For example, if the invoked command was `heft test --verbose`<></>, then `commandName` would be `test`<></>.

Suppose the invoked command was `heft start` which is an alias for `heft build-watch --serve`<></>. In this case, the `commandName` would be `start`<></>. To get the expanded name `build-watch`<></>, use [IHeftParsedCommandLine.unaliasedCommandName](./heft.iheftparsedcommandline.unaliasedcommandname.md) instead.

When invoking phases directly using `heft run`<></>, the `commandName` is `run`<></>.
